== Introduction ==

This page describes the availability and use of icons in the Ubuntu GNOME Wiki. If you wish to insert icons into your wiki page, then please read this page and make full use of the splendid icons available. The page contains instruction on how to use icons in the moinmoin markup and a complete list of the icons themselves. Enjoy!

=== Moinmoin markup ===

The moinmoin markup is the main pagetype to be used in the Ubuntu Wiki. For instructions as to its use, see HelpOnEditing. In order to insert icons or any other images, you simply use their wiki location like this:
<pre>
attachment:UbuntuGNOME/Artwork/Graphics/roundel48.png
</pre>
Produces:

<nowiki>[[File:UbuntuGNOME/Artwork/Graphics/roundel48.png]]</nowiki>

And this is an <nowiki>[[File:UbuntuGNOME/Artwork/Graphics/roundel24.png]]</nowiki> example of an in-line icon, and how the text will wrap around it and all that good stuff.

=== Names and sizes ===
All icons have now been downscaled to 34px. While our main colour remains blue, we've changed it to match the overall look of the wiki.

In the tables below, the names are specified as `icon_name.png`. For instance, if you want to get a roundel, you shall use
<pre>
attachment:UbuntuGNOME/Artwork/Graphics/roundel.png
</pre>
